jsf:property.jsf:description: A mutable Map of the attributes associated with this component, keyed by attribute name.
The number of child components associated with this component.
A mutable List of the child components associated with this component.
A mutable Map of the facets associated with this component, keyed by facet name.
The component family to which this component belongs. This property is used to select an appropriate Renderer.
The component identifier for this component. This value must be unique within the closest parent component that is a naming container.
The parent component for this component. On the root component in the component tree (which must be of type UIViewRoot), this property is null.
Flag indicating whether or not this component should be rendered (during Render Response Phase), or processed on any subsequent form submit. The default value for this property is true.
Identifier used (in conjunction with the "family" property) to select an appropriate Renderer to encode and decode this component.
Flag indicating whether or not this component takes responsibility for rendering its own children. This decision is normally delegated to the associated Renderer, if there is one.

MethodBinding representing the application action to invoke when this component is activated by the user. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes no parameters, and returns a String (the logical outcome) which is passed to the NavigationHandler for this application.

MethodBinding representing an action listener method that will be notified when this component is activated by the user. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes an ActionEvent parameter, with a return type of void.

Flag indicating that, if this component is activated by the user, notifications should be delivered to interested listeners and actions immediately (that is, during Apply Request Values phase) rather than waiting until Invoke Application phase.
The current value of this component.

Flag indicating whether or not this component takes responsibility for rendering its own children. This decision is normally delegated to the associated Renderer, if there is one.
Zero-relative row number of the first row to be displayed. If this property is set to zero, rendering will begin with the first row of the underlying data.
Flag indicating whether there is model data available for the row selected by the current value of the "rowIndex" property.
The number of rows of model data that are available for processing by this component. If the number of rows is unknown, this property will be set to -1.
An object representing the model data for the row selected by the current value of the "rowIndex" property.

Zero-relative index of the currently selected row from the underlying model data. No error will occur if this property is set to point at a row for which no model data exists. To ensure data availability, check the state of the "rowAvailable" property after modifying this property.
The number of rows to display, starting with the one identified by the "first" property. If this value is set to zero, all available rows in the underlying data model will be displayed.
The current value of this component.

Name of a request-scope attribute under which the model data for the row selected by the current value of the "rowIndex" property (i.e. also the current value of the "rowData" property) will be exposed.

For output components, this is the same as the "value" property. For input components, this is the most recently user-entered value, which will be pushed to the application data model during Update Model Values phase, if a value binding is present for the "value" property.
The current value of this component.
Flag indicating whether the "localValue" property of this component has been set. This property is reset automatically when the "value" propertyis set.
Flag indicating that the user is required to provide a submitted value for this input component.

MethodBinding representing a validator method that will be called during Process Validations to perform correctness checks on the value of this component. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes FacesContext, UIComponent, and Object parameters, with a return type of void.

MethodBinding representing a value change listener method that will be notified when a new value has been set for this input component. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes a ValueChangeEvent parameter, with a return type of void.
Flag indicating that this component's value must be converted and validated immediately (that is, during Apply Request Values phase), rather than waiting until Process Validations phase.
Flag indicating whether or not any required conversion or validation on this component value has been performed successfully.

jsf:component.jsf:description: <jsf:p>Represents an HTML <jsf:code>input</jsf:code> element for a button of type <jsf:code>submit</jsf:code> or <jsf:code>reset</jsf:code>. The label text is specified by the component value.</jsf:p>

jsf:property.jsf:description: A mutable Map of the attributes associated with this component, keyed by attribute name.
The number of child components associated with this component.
A mutable List of the child components associated with this component.
A mutable Map of the facets associated with this component, keyed by facet name.
The component family to which this component belongs. This property is used to select an appropriate Renderer.
The component identifier for this component. This value must be unique within the closest parent component that is a naming container.
The parent component for this component. On the root component in the component tree (which must be of type UIViewRoot), this property is null.
Flag indicating whether or not this component should be rendered (during Render Response Phase), or processed on any subsequent form submit. The default value for this property is true.
Identifier used (in conjunction with the "family" property) to select an appropriate Renderer to encode and decode this component.
Flag indicating whether or not this component takes responsibility for rendering its own children. This decision is normally delegated to the associated Renderer, if there is one.

MethodBinding representing the application action to invoke when this component is activated by the user. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes no parameters, and returns a String (the logical outcome) which is passed to the NavigationHandler for this application.

MethodBinding representing an action listener method that will be notified when this component is activated by the user. The expression must evaluate to a public method that takes an ActionEvent parameter, with a return type of void.

Flag indicating that, if this component is activated by the user, notifications should be delivered to interested listeners and actions immediately (that is, during Apply Request Values phase) rather than waiting until Invoke Application phase.
The current value of this component.
CSS style(s) to be applied when this component is rendered.
Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) to be applied when this element is rendered. This value must be passed through as the "class" attribute on generated markup.
Advisory title information about markup elements generated for this component.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is clicked over this element.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is double clicked over this element.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is pressed down over this element.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is released over this element.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved onto this element.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved within this element.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved away from this element.
Javascript code executed when a key is pressed and released over this element.
Javascript code executed when a key is pressed down over this element.
Javascript code executed when a key is released over this element.
Access key that, when pressed, transfers focus to this element.
Javascript code executed when this element loses focus.
Javascript code executed when this element receives focus.
Position of this element in the tabbing order for the current document. This value must be an integer between 0 and 32767.
Direction indication for text that does not inherit directionality. Valid values are "LTR" (left-to-right) and "RTL" (right-to-left).
Code describing the language used in the generated markup for this component.
Flag indicating that this element must never receive focus or be included in a subsequent submit.
Javascript code executed when this element loses focus and its value has been modified since gaining focus.
Javascript code executed when text within this element is selected by the user.
Flag indicating that this component will prohibit changes by the user. The element may receive focus unless it has also been disabled.
Alternate textual description of the element rendered by this component.

Absolute or relative URL of the image to be displayed for this button. If specified, this "input" element will be of type "image". Otherwise, it will be of the type specified by the "type" property with a label specified by the "value" property.
Type of button to create. Valid values are "submit" and "reset". If not specified, or not a valid value, the default value is "submit".

jsf:component.jsf:description: <jsf:p>Represents an HTML <jsf:code>a</jsf:code> element for a hyperlink that acts like a submit button. This component must be placed inside a form, and requires JavaScript to be enabled in the client.</jsf:p>

jsf:component.jsf:description: <jsf:p>Represents a set of repeating data (segregated into columns by child UIColumn components) that will be rendered in an HTML <jsf:code>table</jsf:code> element.</jsf:p>

jsf:property.jsf:description: A mutable Map of the attributes associated with this component, keyed by attribute name.
The number of child components associated with this component.
A mutable List of the child components associated with this component.
A mutable Map of the facets associated with this component, keyed by facet name.
The component family to which this component belongs. This property is used to select an appropriate Renderer.
The component identifier for this component. This value must be unique within the closest parent component that is a naming container.
The parent component for this component. On the root component in the component tree (which must be of type UIViewRoot), this property is null.
Flag indicating whether or not this component should be rendered (during Render Response Phase), or processed on any subsequent form submit. The default value for this property is true.
Identifier used (in conjunction with the "family" property) to select an appropriate Renderer to encode and decode this component.
Flag indicating whether or not this component takes responsibility for rendering its own children. This decision is normally delegated to the associated Renderer, if there is one.
Zero-relative row number of the first row to be displayed. If this property is set to zero, rendering will begin with the first row of the underlying data.
Flag indicating whether there is model data available for the row selected by the current value of the "rowIndex" property.
The number of rows of model data that are available for processing by this component. If the number of rows is unknown, this property will be set to -1.
An object representing the model data for the row selected by the current value of the "rowIndex" property.

Zero-relative index of the currently selected row from the underlying model data. No error will occur if this property is set to point at a row for which no model data exists. To ensure data availability, check the state of the "rowAvailable" property after modifying this property.
The number of rows to display, starting with the one identified by the "first" property. If this value is set to zero, all available rows in the underlying data model will be displayed.
The current value of this component.

Name of a request-scope attribute under which the model data for the row selected by the current value of the "rowIndex" property (i.e. also the current value of the "rowData" property) will be exposed.
CSS style(s) to be applied when this component is rendered.
Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) to be applied when this element is rendered. This value must be passed through as the "class" attribute on generated markup.
Advisory title information about markup elements generated for this component.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is clicked over this element.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is double clicked over this element.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is pressed down over this element.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is released over this element.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved onto this element.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved within this element.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved away from this element.
Javascript code executed when a key is pressed and released over this element.
Javascript code executed when a key is pressed down over this element.
Javascript code executed when a key is released over this element.
Direction indication for text that does not inherit directionality. Valid values are "LTR" (left-to-right) and "RTL" (right-to-left).
Code describing the language used in the generated markup for this component.
Name or code of the background color for this table.
Width (in pixels) of the border to be drawn around this table.
Definition of how much space the user agent should leave between the border of each cell and its contents.

Definition of how much space the user agent should leave between the left side of the table and the leftmost column, the top of the table and the top of the top side of the topmost row, and so on for the right and bottom of the table. It also specifies the amount of space to leave between cells.

Comma-delimited list of CSS style classes that will be applied to the columns of this table. A space separated list of classes may also be specified for any individual column. If the number of elements in this list is less than the number of columns specified in the "columns" attribute, no "class" attribute is output for each column greater than the number of elements in the list. If the number of elements in the list is greater than the number of columns specified in the "columns" attribute, the elements at the posisiton in the list after the value of the "columns" attribute are ignored.
Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) that will be applied to any footer generated for this table.

Code specifying which sides of the frame surrounding this table will be visible. Valid values are: none (no sides, default value); above (top side only); below (bottom side only); hsides (top and bottom sides only); vsides (right and left sides only); lhs (left hand side only); rhs (right hand side only); box (all four sides); and border (all four sides).
Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) that will be applied to any caption generated for this table.
CSS style(s) to be applied when this caption is rendered.
Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) that will be applied to any header generated for this table.

Comma-delimited list of CSS style classes that will be applied to the rows of this table. A space separated list of classes may also be specified for any individual row. Thes styles are applied, in turn, to each row in the table. For example, if the list has two elements, the first style class in the list is applied to the first row, the second to the second row, the first to the third row, the second to the fourth row, etc. In other words, we keep iterating through the list until we reach the end, and then we start at the beginning again.

Code specifying which rules will appear between cells within this table. Valid values are: none (no rules, default value); groups (between row groups); rows (between rows only); cols (between columns only); and all (between all rows and columns).
Summary of this table's purpose and structure, for user agents rendering to non-visual media such as speech and Braille.
Width of the entire table, for visual user agents.

Direction indication for text that does not inherit directionality. Valid values are "LTR" (left-to-right) and "RTL" (right-to-left).
Code describing the language used in the generated markup for this component.
Name or code of the background color for this table.
Width (in pixels) of the border to be drawn around this table.
Definition of how much space the user agent should leave between the border of each cell and its contents.

Definition of how much space the user agent should leave between the left side of the table and the leftmost column, the top of the table and the top of the top side of the topmost row, and so on for the right and bottom of the table. It also specifies the amount of space to leave between cells.

Comma-delimited list of CSS style classes that will be applied to the columns of this table. A space separated list of classes may also be specified for any individual column. If the number of elements in this list is less than the number of columns specified in the "columns" attribute, no "class" attribute is output for each column greater than the number of elements in the list. If the number of elements in the list is greater than the number of columns specified in the "columns" attribute, the elements at the posisiton in the list after the value of the "columns" attribute are ignored.
Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) that will be applied to any footer generated for this table.

Code specifying which sides of the frame surrounding this table will be visible. Valid values are: none (no sides, default value); above (top side only); below (bottom side only); hsides (top and bottom sides only); vsides (right and left sides only); lhs (left hand side only); rhs (right hand side only); box (all four sides); and border (all four sides).
Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) that will be applied to any caption generated for this table.
CSS style(s) to be applied when this caption is rendered.
Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) that will be applied to any header generated for this table.

Comma-delimited list of CSS style classes that will be applied to the rows of this table. A space separated list of classes may also be specified for any individual row. Thes styles are applied, in turn, to each row in the table. For example, if the list has two elements, the first style class in the list is applied to the first row, the second to the second row, the first to the third row, the second to the fourth row, etc. In other words, we keep iterating through the list until we reach the end, and then we start at the beginning again.

Code specifying which rules will appear between cells within this table. Valid values are: none (no rules, default value); groups (between row groups); rows (between rows only); cols (between columns only); and all (between all rows and columns).
Summary of this table's purpose and structure, for user agents rendering to non-visual media such as speech and Braille.
Width of the entire table, for visual user agents.
The number of columns to render before starting a new row.

jsf:render-kit.jsf:description:
The standard HTML RenderKit. Please see the spec for additional details for the standard render-kit.
<jsf:p>General notes on decoding</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Only Renderers for components which cause data to sent to the server on a page submit need to implement decode behavior. In practical terms, this means Renderers for components that implement from <jsf:code>javax.faces.component.EditableValueHolder</jsf:code> or <jsf:code>javax.faces.component.ActionSource</jsf:code> or Renderers for <jsf:code>javax.faces.component.UIForm</jsf:code> components. Renderers for components that do not send data to the server on page submit may choose to accept the no-op decode behavior of the <jsf:code>javax.faces.render.Renderer</jsf:code> abstract class. In the Renderer descriptions that follow, the omission of a Decode Behavior section indicates that this Renderer does no decoding.</jsf:p>
<jsf:p>If a Renderer chooses to implement decode behavior, it must consult the "disabled" and "readonly" attributes of the component to be rendered, if the value of either attribute is equal to, ignoring case, the string "true" (without the quotes) the decode method must take no action and return immediately.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>General notes on encoding</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>If the value of the component's "rendered" property is false, the component, and its children must not be rendered.</jsf:p>
<jsf:p>General notes regarding the <jsf:code>id</jsf:code> attribute</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>All components, and therefore all tags for those components support the <jsf:code>id</jsf:code> attribute. This attribute is optional. If not present its value is autogenerated by the implementation and used for internal purposes only. If present, an <jsf:code>id</jsf:code> attribute must not start with the <jsf:code>String</jsf:code> listed as the value of the constant <jsf:code>UIViewRoot.UNIQUE_ID_PREFIX</jsf:code>, and it must be unique within the scope of the nearest component that is a <jsf:code>NamingContainer</jsf:code>. </jsf:p>
<jsf:p>All renderers must take the following action regarding the <jsf:code>id</jsf:code> attribute: If the value returned from <jsf:code>component.getId()</jsf:code> is non-<jsf:code>null</jsf:code> and does not start with <jsf:code>UIViewRoot.UNIQUE_ID_PREFIX</jsf:code>, call <jsf:code>component.getClientId()</jsf:code> and render the result as the value of the <jsf:code>id</jsf:code> attribute in the markup for the component. See the javadoc for <jsf:code>component.getClientId()</jsf:code> for details, particularly note that the Renderer has a chance to modify the client id before it is rendered. If the component doesn't generate any markup elements, include the <jsf:code>id</jsf:code> attribte on a "span" element that encloses the content for the component.</jsf:p>
<jsf:p>In addition to any action already specified in the renderers, all renderers for <jsf:code>UIInput</jsf:code> components must take the following action regarding the <jsf:code>id</jsf:code> attribute: Call <jsf:code>component.getClientId()</jsf:code> and render the result as the value of the <jsf:code>name</jsf:code> attribute. This may cause some renderers to have "id" and "name" attributes that have exactly the same value.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>
</jsf:ul>

jsf:renderer.jsf:description:
<jsf:p>Renders an HTML "input" element.</jsf:p>
<jsf:p>Decode Behavior</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Obtain the <jsf:code>Map</jsf:code> from the "requestParameterMap" property of the <jsf:code>ExternalContext</jsf:code>. If the value in the <jsf:code>Map</jsf:code> for the value of the "clientId" property of the component is <jsf:code>null</jsf:code>, create a String by concatenating the value of the "clientId" property of the component with the String ".x" (without the quotes). Create another String in the same manner, but concatenate ".y" (without the quotes). If <jsf:code>null</jsf:code> is the value in the <jsf:code>Map</jsf:code> for both Strings, return from <jsf:code>decode()</jsf:code>. If the value in the <jsf:code>Map</jsf:code> for the value of the "clientId" property of the component is not <jsf:code>null</jsf:code>, get the value of the "type" attribute, and convert it to lower case. If the result is equal to the String "reset" (without the quotes), return from <jsf:code>decode()</jsf:code>. Otherwise, create a <jsf:code>javax.faces.event.ActionEvent</jsf:code> around the component, and pass it to the <jsf:code>queueEvent()</jsf:code> method of the component, which must be an instance of <jsf:code>UICommand</jsf:code>.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Encode Behavior</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Render the clientId of the component as the value of the "name" attribute. Render the current value of the component as the value of the "value" attribute. If the "styleClass" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>

jsf:renderer.jsf:description:
<jsf:p>Render an HTML "a" anchor element that acts like a form submit button when clicked.</jsf:p>
<jsf:p>General Behaviour</jsf:p>
<jsf:p>Both the encode and decode behavior require the ability to get the id/name for a hidden field whose value is set by the JavaScript form submit. This name must be constructed as follows:</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:li><jsf:p>Get the clientId for the form of which this component is a child.</jsf:p></jsf:li>
<jsf:li><jsf:p>Append <jsf:code>NamingContainer.SEPARATOR_CHAR</jsf:code>.</jsf:p></jsf:li>
<jsf:li><jsf:p>Append a constant string that is the same for all command link components in the tree.</jsf:p></jsf:li>
</jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>In the following text, this String is called hiddenFieldName.</jsf:p>
<jsf:p>Decode Behavior</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Obtain the "clientId" property of the component. Obtain the <jsf:code>Map</jsf:code> from the "requestParameterMap" property of the <jsf:code>ExternalContext</jsf:code>. Derive hiddenFieldName as above. Get the entry in the <jsf:code>Map</jsf:code> under the key that is the hiddenFieldName. If the there is no entry, or the entry is the empty String, or the entry is not equal to the value of the "clientId" property, return immediately. If there is an entry, and its value is equal to the value of the "clientId" property, create a new <jsf:code>javax.faces.event.ActionEvent</jsf:code> instance around the component and call <jsf:code>queueActionEvent()</jsf:code> on the component, passing the event.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Encode Behavior</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Render "#" as the value of the "href" attribute. Render the current value of the component as the link text if it is specified. Render javascript that is functionally equivalent to the following as the value of the "onclick" attribute:</jsf:p>
<jsf:p><jsf:code>document.forms['CLIENT_ID']['hiddenFieldName'].value='CLIENT_ID'; document.forms['CLIENT_ID']['PARAM1_NAME'].value='PARAM1_VALUE'; document.forms['CLIENT_ID']['PARAM2_NAME'].value='PARAM2_VALUE'; return false;</jsf:code></jsf:p>
<jsf:p>document.forms['CLIENT_ID'].submit()" where hiddenFieldName is as described above, CLIENT_ID is the clientId of the UICommand component, PARAM*_NAME and PARAM*_VALUE are the names and values, respectively, of any nested UIParameter children. The name and the value must be URLEncoded. If the "styleClass" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute. Render any non-UIParameter children as normal inside of the "a" element. These will appear as the link text. Allow the form renderer to output a single "input" element (for the entire page, regardless of how many command link components are in the page) of "type" "hidden" whose "name" is the value of hiddenFieldName, and which must not have a "value" attribute. Multiple occurrences of command link components in the tree should not cause multiple hiddenFieldName hidden fields. Allow the form renderer to output an "input" element of "type" "hidden" for each of the nested UIParameter children, taking the name property (but not the value) from each one in turn.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>

jsf:renderer.jsf:description:
<jsf:p>Renders an HTML "table" element compliant with the HTML 401 specification. Render the "caption" facet, if present, inside a "caption" element immediately below the "table" element. If the "captionClass" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute on the "caption" element. If the "captionStyle" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "style" attribute on the "caption" element.</jsf:p> <jsf:p>Please consult the javadoc for <jsf:code>UIData</jsf:code> to supplement this specification. If the "styleClass" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute on the "table" element. Any pass-through attributes are also rendered on the "table" element. </jsf:p>
<jsf:p>Rendering the header</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>If the <jsf:code>UIData</jsf:code> component has a "header" facet, or any of the child <jsf:code>UIColumn</jsf:code> components has a "header" facet, render a "thead" element. If the <jsf:code>UIData</jsf:code> component has a "header" facet, encode its contents inside of "tr" and "th" elements, respectively. Output the value of the "headerClass" attribute of the <jsf:code>UIData</jsf:code> component, if present, as the value of the "class" attribute on the "th". Output the number of child <jsf:code>UIColumn</jsf:code> components of the <jsf:code>UIData</jsf:code> component as the value of the "colspan" attribute on the "th". Output "colgroup" as the value of the "scope" attribute on the "th" element. </jsf:p>
<jsf:p>If any of the child <jsf:code>UIColumn</jsf:code> components has a "header" facet render a "tr" element. For each <jsf:code>UIColumn</jsf:code> that actually has a "header" facet, render it inside of a "th" element. Columns that don't have a "header" facet cause an empty "th" element to be rendered. Output the value of the "headerClass" attribute of the <jsf:code>UIData</jsf:code> component, if present, as the value of the "class" attribute on the "th". Output "col" as the value of the "colgroup" attribute on the "th" element. </jsf:p>
<jsf:p>Close out the "thead" element.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Rendering the footer</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Follow the same process as for the header, except replace "header" with "footer", "th" with "td", "thead" with "tfoot", and "headerClass" with "footerClass". Do not render any "scope" attribute for the footer.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Rendering the table body</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Render a "tbody" element. Keep track of the result of the "rows" property on the <jsf:code>UIData</jsf:code> component. Keep track of the number of rows we have rendered so far. Iterate through the rows. Set the "rowIndex" property of the <jsf:code>UIData</jsf:code> component to be correct as we iterate through the rows. Stop rendering children and close out the "tbody" element if the "rowAvailable" property of the <jsf:code>UIData</jsf:code> returned false. Output a "tr" element. Output the value of the "rowClasses" per the attribute description below. For each <jsf:code>UIColumn</jsf:code> child, output a "td" element, attaching the value of the "columnClasses" attribute of the <jsf:code>UIData</jsf:code> component per the attribute description below. Recursively encode each child of each <jsf:code>UIColumn</jsf:code> child. Close out the "td" element. When done with the row, close out the "tr" element. When done with all the rows, close out the "tbody" element.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>When done rendering all the rows, set the "rowIndex" property of the <jsf:code>UIData</jsf:code> to -1, and close out the "table" element.</jsf:p>

jsf:attribute.jsf:description: CSS style(s) to be applied when this component is rendered.
Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) to be applied when this element is rendered. This value must be passed through as the "class" attribute on generated markup.

Javascript code executed when a pointer button is released over this element.

Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved within this element.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved away from this element.
Javascript code executed when a key is pressed and released over this element.
Javascript code executed when a key is pressed down over this element.
Javascript code executed when a key is released over this element.
Direction indication for text that does not inherit directionality. Valid values are "LTR" (left-to-right) and "RTL" (right-to-left).
Code describing the language used in the generated markup for this component.
Name or code of the background color for this table.
Width (in pixels) of the border to be drawn around this table.
Definition of how much space the user agent should leave between the border of each cell and its contents.

Definition of how much space the user agent should leave between the left side of the table and the leftmost column, the top of the table and the top of the top side of the topmost row, and so on for the right and bottom of the table. It also specifies the amount of space to leave between cells.

Comma-delimited list of CSS style classes that will be applied to the columns of this table. A space separated list of classes may also be specified for any individual column. If the number of elements in this list is less than the number of columns specified in the "columns" attribute, no "class" attribute is output for each column greater than the number of elements in the list. If the number of elements in the list is greater than the number of columns specified in the "columns" attribute, the elements at the posisiton in the list after the value of the "columns" attribute are ignored.
Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) that will be applied to any footer generated for this table.

Code specifying which sides of the frame surrounding this table will be visible. Valid values are: none (no sides, default value); above (top side only); below (bottom side only); hsides (top and bottom sides only); vsides (right and left sides only); lhs (left hand side only); rhs (right hand side only); box (all four sides); and border (all four sides).
Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) that will be applied to any caption generated for this table.
CSS style(s) to be applied when this caption is rendered.
Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) that will be applied to any header generated for this table.

Comma-delimited list of CSS style classes that will be applied to the rows of this table. A space separated list of classes may also be specified for any individual row. Thes styles are applied, in turn, to each row in the table. For example, if the list has two elements, the first style class in the list is applied to the first row, the second to the second row, the first to the third row, the second to the fourth row, etc. In other words, we keep iterating through the list until we reach the end, and then we start at the beginning again.

Code specifying which rules will appear between cells within this table. Valid values are: none (no rules, default value); groups (between row groups); rows (between rows only); cols (between columns only); and all (between all rows and columns).
Summary of this table's purpose and structure, for user agents rendering to non-visual media such as speech and Braille.
Width of the entire table, for visual user agents.

jsf:renderer.jsf:description:
<jsf:p>Renders an HTML "form" element.</jsf:p>
<jsf:p>Decode Behavior</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Obtain the <jsf:code>Map</jsf:code> from the "requestParameterMap" property of the <jsf:code>ExternalContext</jsf:code>. If the map contains an entry for the "clientId" of this <jsf:code>UIForm</jsf:code> component, call <jsf:code>setSubmitted(true)</jsf:code> on the form, otherwise call <jsf:code>setSubmitted(false)</jsf:code> on the form.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Encode Behavior</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>The value of the "method" attribute must be "post". The value of the "action" attribute must be the result of passing the view identifier of the current view to the <jsf:code>getActionURL()</jsf:code> method of the <jsf:code>ViewHandler</jsf:code> for this application, then passing that String to the <jsf:code>encodeActionURL()</jsf:code> method on the <jsf:code>ExternalContext</jsf:code>. If the "styleClass" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute. Call <jsf:code>ViewHandler.writeState()</jsf:code> before the the close of the "form" element. Render all the necessary hidden fields for all commandLink instances in the page just before the close of the "form" element.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>

jsf:renderer.jsf:description:
<jsf:p>Render a single message for a specific component.</jsf:p>
<jsf:p>Set-up for Rendering</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Obtain the "summary" and "detail" properties from <jsf:code>UIMessage</jsf:code> component. If not present, keep the empty string as the value, respectively. Obtain the first <jsf:code>FacesMessage</jsf:code> to render from the component, using the "for" property of the <jsf:code>UIMessage</jsf:code>. This will be the only message we render. Obtain the severity style for this message. If the severity of the message is <jsf:code>FacesMessage.SEVERITY_INFO</jsf:code>, the severity style comes from the value of the "infoStyle" attribute. If the severity of the message is <jsf:code>FacesMessage.SEVERITY_WARN</jsf:code>, the severity style comes from the value of the "warnStyle" attribute, and so on for each of the severities, <jsf:code>INFO, WARN, ERROR</jsf:code> and <jsf:code>FATAL</jsf:code>. The same rules apply for obtaining the severity style class, but instead of "infoStyle, warnStyle", etc use "infoClass, warnClass", etc. Obtain the "style", "styleClass" and "layout" attributes from the <jsf:code>UIMessage</jsf:code> component. If we have a "style" attribute and a severity style attribute, use the severity style attribute as the value of the "style" attribute. If we have no "style" attribute, but do have a severity style, use the severity style as the value of the "style" attribute. The same precedence rules apply for the style class. Obtain the value of the <jsf:code>dir</jsf:code> and <jsf:code>lang</jsf:code> attributes.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Rendering</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>For the message renderer, we only render one row, for the first message. For the messages renderer, we render as many rows as we have messages. If any of the "dir", "lang", "style" or "styleClass" attributes has a non-null value (as determined above), render a "span" element, outputting the value of the "style" attribute as the the value of the "style" attribute, and outputting the value of the "styleClass" attribute as the value of the "class" attribute on the "span" element. Output the "dir" and "lang" attributes as well, if they are present. If the <jsf:code>UIMessage</jsf:code> has a "tooltip" attribute with the value of "true", and the <jsf:code>UIMessage</jsf:code> has "showSummary" and "showDetail" properties with the value "true", if we haven't already written out the "span", output the "summary" as the value of the "title" attribute on the "span". If we haven't already written out a "title" attribute, and "showSummary" is true, output the summary. If "showDetail" is true, output the detail. Close out the span if necessary.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>

If the value of the "layout" attribute is "table", render nested "table", "tr", and "td" elements, in that order, otherwise, don't render the table. The component is a <jsf:code>UIMessages</jsf:code>, and there is no "for" attribute. Therefore, use either <jsf:code>null</jsf:code> to obtain the messages from the <jsf:code>FacesContext</jsf:code> or the empty string if the components "globalOnly" property is <jsf:code>true</jsf:code>. If the layout was "table" close out the table elements. </jsf:p>

jsf:renderer.jsf:description: <jsf:p>Render parameterized text. Obtain the <jsf:code>style</jsf:code>, <jsf:code>styleClass</jsf:code>, <jsf:code>dir</jsf:code>, and <jsf:code>lang</jsf:code> attributees from this component. If any are present, render a "span" element. Output the <jsf:code>styleClass</jsf:code> attribute (if present) as the value of the <jsf:code>class</jsf:code> attribute. Output the <jsf:code>style</jsf:code> attribute as the value of the <jsf:code>style</jsf:code> attribute. Output the <jsf:code>dir</jsf:code> and <jsf:code>lang</jsf:code> attributes as pass through attributes. Accrue a list of the values of all child <jsf:code>UIParameter</jsf:code> components of this component. If there are one or more accumulated parameter values, convert the list of parameter values to an <jsf:code>Object</jsf:code> array, call <jsf:code>MessageFormat.format()</jsf:code>, passing the <jsf:code>value</jsf:code> of this component as the first argument, and the array of parameter values as the second argument, and render the result. Otherwise, render the <jsf:code>value</jsf:code> of this component unmodified.</jsf:p>

If "styleClass" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute.

jsf:renderer.jsf:description: Render an HTML "a" anchor element. The value of the component is rendered as the value of the "href" attribute. Any child UIParameter components are appended to the String to be output as the value of the "href" attribute as query parameters before rendering. The entire "href" string must be passed through a call to the <jsf:code>encodeResourceURL()</jsf:code> method of the <jsf:code>ExternalContext</jsf:code>. The name of the UIParameter goes on the left hand side, and the value of the UIParameter on the right hand side. The name and the value must be URLEncoded. Each UIParameter instance is separeted by an ampersand, as dictated in the URL spec. If the "styleClass" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute.

jsf:renderer.jsf:description: If the "styleClass", "style", "dir" or "lang" attributes are present, render a "span" element. If the "styleClass" attribute is present, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute. If the "style" attribute is present, pass it thru. If the "escape" attribute is not present, or it is present and its value is "true" all angle brackets should be converted to the ampersand xx semicolon syntax when rendering the value of the "value" attribute as the value of the component. If the "escape" attribute is present and is "false" the value of the component should be rendered as text without escaping.

jsf:renderer.jsf:description: Renders an HTML "table" element, conforming to the rules in the HTML 401 specification. If the "styleClass" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute. Render the pass-through attributes in the table below. Render the "header" facet, if present, inside of "thead", "tr", and "th" elements, nested in that order. If the "headerClass" attribute is specifed, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute on the "th" element. Render "colgroup" as the value of the "scope" attribute. Render the value of the "columns" attribute as the value of the "colspan" attribute on the "th" element. Render the "footer" facet if present, using similar logic to the rendering of the "header", but replacing "thead" with "tfoot", "th" with "td", and "headerClass" with "footerClass". Render the children of the <jsf:code>UIPanel</jsf:code> component inside of a "tbody" element. Render the children based on the value of the "columns" attribute, creating a new row each time a "columns" worth of children have been rendered. Each child is rendered inside of a "td" element. If a child has "rendered==false" it is not rendered, and the column counter must not be incremented.

jsf:attribute.jsf:description: CSS style(s) to be applied when this component is rendered.
Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) to be applied when this element is rendered. This value must be passed through as the "class" attribute on generated markup.
Advisory title information about markup elements generated for this component.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is clicked over this element.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is double clicked over this element.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is pressed down over this element.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is released over this element.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved onto this element.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved within this element.
Javascript code executed when a pointer button is moved away from this element.
Javascript code executed when a key is pressed and released over this element.
Javascript code executed when a key is pressed down over this element.
Javascript code executed when a key is released over this element.
Direction indication for text that does not inherit directionality. Valid values are "LTR" (left-to-right) and "RTL" (right-to-left).
Code describing the language used in the generated markup for this component.
Name or code of the background color for this table.
Width (in pixels) of the border to be drawn around this table.
Definition of how much space the user agent should leave between the border of each cell and its contents.

Definition of how much space the user agent should leave between the left side of the table and the leftmost column, the top of the table and the top of the top side of the topmost row, and so on for the right and bottom of the table. It also specifies the amount of space to leave between cells.

Comma-delimited list of CSS style classes that will be applied to the columns of this table. A space separated list of classes may also be specified for any individual column. If the number of elements in this list is less than the number of columns specified in the "columns" attribute, no "class" attribute is output for each column greater than the number of elements in the list. If the number of elements in the list is greater than the number of columns specified in the "columns" attribute, the elements at the posisiton in the list after the value of the "columns" attribute are ignored.
Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) that will be applied to any footer generated for this table.

Code specifying which sides of the frame surrounding this table will be visible. Valid values are: none (no sides, default value); above (top side only); below (bottom side only); hsides (top and bottom sides only); vsides (right and left sides only); lhs (left hand side only); rhs (right hand side only); box (all four sides); and border (all four sides).
Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) that will be applied to any caption generated for this table.
CSS style(s) to be applied when this caption is rendered.
Space-separated list of CSS style class(es) that will be applied to any header generated for this table.

Comma-delimited list of CSS style classes that will be applied to the rows of this table. A space separated list of classes may also be specified for any individual row. Thes styles are applied, in turn, to each row in the table. For example, if the list has two elements, the first style class in the list is applied to the first row, the second to the second row, the first to the third row, the second to the fourth row, etc. In other words, we keep iterating through the list until we reach the end, and then we start at the beginning again.

Code specifying which rules will appear between cells within this table. Valid values are: none (no rules, default value); groups (between row groups); rows (between rows only); cols (between columns only); and all (between all rows and columns).
Summary of this table's purpose and structure, for user agents rendering to non-visual media such as speech and Braille.
Width of the entire table, for visual user agents.
The number of columns to render before starting a new row.

jsf:renderer.jsf:description: Intended for use in situations when only one UIComponent child can be nested, such as in the case of facets. If the "style" or "styleClass" attributes are present, render a "span" element, outputting the value of the "style" attribute as the value of the "style" attribute, and the value of the "styleClass" attribute as the value of the "class" attribute.

jsf:renderer.jsf:description:
<jsf:p>Renders an HTML "input" element of type "checkbox".</jsf:p>
<jsf:p>Decode Behavior</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Obtain the <jsf:code>Map</jsf:code> from the "requestParameterMap" property of the <jsf:code>ExternalContext</jsf:code>. If there is no entry in the <jsf:code>Map</jsf:code> for the "clientId" of this component, pass "false" to the <jsf:code>setSubmittedValue()</jsf:code> method of the component, which must be an instance of <jsf:code>EditableValueHolder</jsf:code>. If there is an entry, and its value is equal, ignoring case and without quotes, to any of the Strings: "on", "yes" or "true" pass true to the <jsf:code>setSubmittedValue()</jsf:code> method of the component.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Encode Behavior</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p> Render the clientId of the component as the value of the "name" attribute. If the current value of the component is "true", output the "checked" attribute. If the "styleClass" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute.</jsf:p> </jsf:ul>

jsf:renderer.jsf:description:
<jsf:p>Render an HTML checkbox list.</jsf:p>
<jsf:p><jsf:a name="decode">Decode Behavior</jsf:a></jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>See the <jsf:a href="javax.faces.SelectManyjavax.faces.Listbox.html#decodeMany">"Decode Behavior for UISelectMany Components"</jsf:a> section.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Encode Behavior</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul> <jsf:p>Render a "table" element. If the "styleClass" is specified, render the value of the "styleClass" attribute as the value of the "class" attribute on the "table" element. If the "style", "border" attributes are specified, pass them thru. If the "layout" attribute is specified, and its value is "pageDirection", render the children elements vertically, otherwise horizontally, in the table. If any of the children are an instance of SelectItemGroup, render them as a nested table. Each of the children are ultimately rendererd as follows. Render a "label" element. Inside of the "label", render an "input" element of "type" "checkbox" for each child component. As an exception to the general rules about how to handle the "id" attribute, render it as an attribute on the outer "table" element, the value of which is the <jsf:code>clientId</jsf:code> of the component per the rules at the beginning of this specification.The "id" attribute must not be output on each "input" element. The value of the current SelectItem is rendered as the value of the "value" attribute. If the value of the enclosing UISelectMany matches the current value, render "checked" as the value of the "checked" attribute. If the current SelectItem.isDisabled() returns true, render "disabled" as the value of the "disabled" attribute. Close out the "input" element and render the return value from SelectItem.getLabel(). Close out the "label" element and any other nested elements. See the <jsf:a href="javax.faces.SelectManyjavax.faces.Listbox.html#options">"Rendering the option elements" </jsf:a> specification for <jsf:code>ListboxRenderer</jsf:code> for more detail on how to render the "option" elements in this renderer.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>

jsf:renderer.jsf:description:
<jsf:p>Render an HTML option list.</jsf:p>
<jsf:p>Decode Behavior</jsf:p>
<jsf:p>This section documents the decode behavior for all renderers that handle <jsf:code>UISelectMany</jsf:code> or <jsf:code>UISelectOne</jsf:code> components.</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p><jsf:a name="decodeMany">Decode Behavior for <jsf:code>UISelectMany</jsf:code> components</jsf:a></jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Obtain the <jsf:code>Map</jsf:code> from the "requestParameterValuesMap" property of the <jsf:code>ExternalContext</jsf:code>. If the <jsf:code>Map</jsf:code> contains an entry for the "clientId" of the component, pass the value of the entry, cast to a <jsf:code>String []</jsf:code>, to the <jsf:code>setSubmittedValue()</jsf:code> method of the component, which must be an <jsf:code>EditableValueHolder</jsf:code>. If the <jsf:code>Map</jsf:code> does not contain an entry, create an empty <jsf:code>String</jsf:code> array and call <jsf:code>setSubmittedValue()</jsf:code> with it.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>
<jsf:p><jsf:a name="decodeOne">Decode Behavior for <jsf:code>UISelectOne</jsf:code> components</jsf:a></jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Obtain the <jsf:code>Map</jsf:code> from the "requestParameterMap" property of the <jsf:code>ExternalContext</jsf:code>. If there is a <jsf:code>Map</jsf:code> entry for the "clientId" property of the component, pass it to the <jsf:code>setSubmittedValue()</jsf:code> method of the component.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Encode Behavior</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Render an HTML "select" element. Render the clientId of the component as the value of the "name" attribute. If the "styleClass" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute on the "select" element. If the component is a <jsf:code>UISelectMany</jsf:code> instance, render "multiple" as the value of the "multiple" attribute. If the "size" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "size" attribute. Otherwise use the number of items as the value of the "size" attribute.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>
<jsf:p><jsf:a name="option">Rendering the "option" elements</jsf:a></jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>The only valid children of this component are <jsf:code>UISelectItem</jsf:code> or <jsf:code>UISelectItems</jsf:code> instances. Iterate over the children of this component, and accrue a list of <jsf:code>javax.faces.model.SelectItem</jsf:code> instances. If the current child is a <jsf:code>UISelectItem</jsf:code> create a <jsf:code>SelectItem</jsf:code>instance from its <jsf:code>itemValue, itemLabel</jsf:code> and <jsf:code>itemDescription</jsf:code> properties, add it to the list. If the current child is a <jsf:code>UISelectItems</jsf:code> instance, call its <jsf:code>getValue()</jsf:code> method. If the result is a <jsf:code>SelectItem</jsf:code> bean, add it to the list. If the result is an array of <jsf:code>SelectItem</jsf:code> beans, add each one t othe list. If the result is a <jsf:code>Collection</jsf:code> of <jsf:code>SelectItem</jsf:code> beans, add each one to the list. If the result isa <jsf:code>Map</jsf:code>, create a <jsf:code>SelectItem</jsf:code> bean for each entry in the <jsf:code>Map</jsf:code> using the key as the label, the value as the value, and <jsf:code>null</jsf:code> as the description. Iterate over the list of <jsf:code>SelectItem</jsf:code> beans. If the current element is a <jsf:code>SelectItemGroup</jsf:code>, render an "optgroup" element with a "label" attribute, the value of which is the "label" property from the current element, then call <jsf:code>getSelectItems()</jsf:code> and render each element as below. If the current element is not a <jsf:code>SelectItemGroup</jsf:code>, render an "option" element. Follow the conversion rules in the spec to obtain a renderable <jsf:code>String</jsf:code> from the "value" property of the current element, render that as the value of the "value" atribute. Now it is time to see if the current element is the selected value. call its <jsf:code>getSubmittedValue()</jsf:code> method, casting the result to an <jsf:code>Object []</jsf:code>, otherwise the component must be a <jsf:code>UISelectOne</jsf:code> instance, call its <jsf:code>getSubmittedValue()</jsf:code> method and create an <jsf:code>Object []</jsf:code> around the result. If the resultant array is non-null, we look in the array for a value that, when we pass the renderable value to its <jsf:code>equals()</jsf:code> method, it returns <jsf:code>true</jsf:code>, meaning the current element is selected. If the resultant array is <jsf:code>null</jsf:code>, if the component is a <jsf:code>UISelectMany</jsf:code>, call its <jsf:code>getValue()</jsf:code> method. If the result is a <jsf:code>List</jsf:code> obtain the values in the list as an array. Otherwise, the component must be a <jsf:code>UISelectOne</jsf:code> instance. Call its <jsf:code>getValue()</jsf:code> method, which must be an Object array. Look for an element in the resultant array that, 1. when we pass the renderable value to its <jsf:code>equals()</jsf:code> method, it returns <jsf:code>true</jsf:code> , or 2. if the renderable value is null, and there is a null element in the array, also conclude that the current element is selected. Otherwise the current element is not selected. Now, if the current value is selected, write out an HTML boolean property "selected". If the current SelectItem.isDisabled() returns true, render "disabled" as the value of the "disabled" attribute.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>
</jsf:ul>

jsf:renderer.jsf:description:
<jsf:p>Render an HTML option list.</jsf:p>
<jsf:p><jsf:a name="decode">Decode Behavior</jsf:a></jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>See the <jsf:a href="javax.faces.SelectManyjavax.faces.Listbox.html#decodeMany">"Decode Behavior for UISelectMany Components"</jsf:a> section.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Encode Behavior</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Render an HTML "select" element. Render the clientId of the component as the value of the "name" attribute. If the "styleClass" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute on the "select" element. If the component to be rendered is a UISelectMany, render "true" as the value of the "multiple" attribute. Render "1" as the value of the "size" attribute. See the <jsf:a href="javax.faces.SelectManyjavax.faces.Listbox.html#options">"Rendering the option elements" </jsf:a> specification for <jsf:code>ListboxRenderer</jsf:code> for more detail on how to render the "option" elements in this renderer.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>

<jsf:p>Encode Behavior</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul> <jsf:p>Render an HTML "select" element. Render the clientId of the component as the value of the "name" attribute. If the "styleClass" attribute is specified, render its value as the value of the "class" attribute on the "select" element. Otherwise use the number of items as the value of the "size" attribute. See the <jsf:a href="javax.faces.SelectManyjavax.faces.Listbox.html#options">"Rendering the option elements" </jsf:a> specification for <jsf:code>ListboxRenderer</jsf:code> for more detail on how to render the "option" elements in this renderer.</jsf:p>

jsf:renderer.jsf:description:
<jsf:p>Render a set of html "input" elements of type "radio".</jsf:p>
<jsf:p><jsf:a name="decode">Decode Behavior</jsf:a></jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>See the <jsf:a href="javax.faces.SelectManyjavax.faces.Listbox.html#decodeOne">"Decode Behavior for UISelectOne Components"</jsf:a> section.</jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Encode Behavior</jsf:p>
<jsf:ul>
<jsf:p>Render a "table" element. If the "styleClass" is specified, render the value of the "styleClass" attribute as the value of the "class" attribute on the "table" element. If the "style", "border" attributes are specified, pass them thru. If the "layout" attribute is specified, and its value is "pageDirection", render the children elements vertically, otherwise horizontally, in the table. If any of the children are an instance of SelectItemGroup, render them as a nested table. Render a "label" element. Each of the children are ultimately rendererd as an "input" element of "type" "radio". As an exception to the general rules about how to handle the "id" attribute, render it as an attribute on the outer "table" element, the value of which is the <jsf:code>clientId</jsf:code> of the component per the rules at the beginning of this specification. The "id" attribute must not be output on each "input" element. Output the value of the "label" attribute of the <jsf:code>SelectItem</jsf:code> after the "input" element. If the value of the currently rendered child is equal to the value of the parent UISelectOne, render an appropriate HTML boolean value indicating "checked" for the enclosing "input". If the current SelectItem.isDisabled() returns true, render "disabled" as the value of the "disabled" attribute. See the <jsf:a href="javax.faces.SelectManyjavax.faces.Listbox.html#options">"Rendering the option elements" </jsf:a> specification for <jsf:code>ListboxRenderer</jsf:code> for more detail on how to render the "option" elements in this renderer. Close out the "label" element. </jsf:p>
</jsf:ul>
